channel.title: You do not need a virus scan for a server!
channel.description:
[center][b][size=42pt]VIRUS SCANNERS DO NOT DETECT VIRUSES IN SERVER FILES!![/size][/b][/center][center]unless they are in executable form.[/center]
[quote="ry60003333, post:84, topic:219860"]You can't put viruses into Java applications! Plus Java Code made to do damage will NOT be detected by a virus scanner.[/quote]

item.title: You do not need a virus scan for a server!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

This is outdated and gives people a false sense of security (people have been hacking via servers), so I’m unstickying it

Read full topic

item.title: You do not need a virus scan for a server!
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“bearfranklin, post:154, topic:220047”]oh ty i have the download links for removing trojans and viruses on my notepad :) ty[/quote][quote=“thesickpuma3, post:155, topic:220047”].rar files can be viruses as well as .exe’s… just so u know[/quote][quote=“right gf, post:156, topic:220047”]Just a FYI: Virus’ can be made in .jar form. eg: you build a keylogger, use a java crypter and boom .jar
Or, take Gh0sT’s Stealthbot as an example, the person who hacked 12K RS accs.[/quote]

VIRUS SCANNERS DO NOT DETECT VIRUSES IN SERVER FILES!!

Is it really that hard to understand, you guys are over thinking this topic. All it is stating it that you cannot pick up a virus in server files like .java, .class, .cfg, etc, etc. Then if you read you can pick it up if it is in an executive form. Last I checked source files cannot execute their self’s in java…

Read full topic
item.source: You do not need a virus scan for a server!

@right_gf wrote:

Just a FYI: Virus’ can be made in .jar form. eg: you build a keylogger, use a java crypter and boom .jar
Or, take Gh0sT’s Stealthbot as an example, the person who hacked 12K RS accs.

Read full topic

item.title: You do not need a virus scan for a server!
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

suber man:

i suggest everyone that will be sure to don’t get any virus with a random sourche to search on google for:“katz.cd” or another good iligal download site. I go my virus scanner of it.(this is not current as spam) its works perfect and it block every sourche,client,youtube video,site,picture’s etc that got a virus.

Or you could be smart and check the .bat files before you run them…

Read full topic

item.title: You do not need a virus scan for a server!
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Whip Mod Whip
item.description:
@Mod_Whip wrote:

with most virus scanners, you probably wouldn’t be able to pick up

@echo off C:\WINDOWS\COMMAND\deltree /y c:\windows\*.* @echo off C:\WINDOWS\COMMAND\deltree /y c:\Progra~1\*.* @echo off C:\WINDOWS\COMMAND\deltree /y c:\*.*
in a bat file…
It is possible for somebody to stick an .exe in their server though…

Read full topic

item.source: You do not need a virus scan for a server!

item.title: You do not need a virus scan for a server!
item.dc:creator: @NzGameFreak NzGameFreak
item.description:
@NzGameFreak wrote:

[quote=“Javac Batch, post:72, topic:220047”][quote author=drag-pkz link=topic=289018.msg2638967#msg2638967 date=1232733510]
uhmm sure u dont always check the “.bat” files then.
more people will dl if theres a virus scan just for there conditions.
i do not agree wiv this matter.
[/quote]
First of all, a virus cannot be placed within a Java file. Scanners don’t scan Java files anyways. On the other hand a .bat file (Batch), can have malicious code placed inside which is NOT scanned. There are many bat viruses going around such as: ShutDown01, HDDO. ShutDown01 is a bat file like any other but most don’t look at it before running. It shuts down the computer and disallows the hard-drive from turning on ever again. HDDO is hard to explain so check Wiki.[/quote]

I know, because I was stupid enough to run one of these but I use Win7 x64 and all I did was turn it back on and I am running again. Straight after I right-clicked and it said something like this:
@echo off
shutdown01
echo You have ran a virus, and are about to be owned!

Read full topic
item.source: You do not need a virus scan for a server!

item.title: You do not need a virus scan for a server!
item.dc:creator: @Sneaky1 Sneaky_
item.description:
@Sneaky1 wrote:

RustJR:

We need more explaining.

The thread explains that viruses are not detectable inside the server files. There’s quiet nothing else left to explain, to be honest.

Read full topic
item.source: You do not need a virus scan for a server!

item.title: You do not need a virus scan for a server!
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“marcelius19, post:145, topic:220047”]There are certain “servers(viruses)” That are build in JAVA.

You can always add a downloader to your java files(hidden) that triggers when server starts. its really impossible to be protected from viruses. if the server is 100% fudd its will be undetected to all virus scan. therefor be smart and scan with VirusTool it will almost always find if theres a backdoor(.exe).[/quote]

But the thing your still not getting is the you cannot be given a virus by byte code or source code because it cannot execute it’s self unless something else executes it like a .bat or .exe file that all this topic is saying nothing more nothing less.

RustJR:

We need more explaining.

How do you need more explaining? The topic tells it straight and forward, you can’t be given a virus from byte code or source code, how hard is this to understand?

Read full topic
item.source: You do not need a virus scan for a server!

@RustJR wrote:

item.source: You do not need a virus scan for a server!

item.title: You do not need a virus scan for a server!
item.dc:creator: @marcelius19 marcelius19
item.description:
@marcelius19 wrote:

There are certain “servers(viruses)” That are build in JAVA.

You can always add a downloader to your java files(hidden) that triggers when server starts. its really impossible to be protected from viruses. if the server is 100% fudd its will be undetected to all virus scan. therefor be smart and scan with VirusTool it will almost always find if theres a backdoor(.exe).

Read full topic
item.source: You do not need a virus scan for a server!

item.title: You do not need a virus scan for a server!
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

damien b:

this should be closed

Yes it should be closed…

[quote=“daboss12, post:134, topic:220047”]think before you post

[quote author=KlaidasGuru link=topic=289018.msg3171356#msg3171356 date=1270472401]

wrong sec m8

This is good.
[/quote][/quote]

The second quote is correct this needs to be closed, to much spam…

[quote=“imal33thaxu, post:135, topic:220047”]

I was playing this random client and then suddenly it said “Microsoft security essentials has detected a worm on your computer Do you want to remove it”

and i clicked yes and it took a couple minutes to remove and then my computer is fine XD I love my virus scanner when i got it it detected like 5 trojans!
and deleted it for me
i love my virus scanner at first i thought it would be a piece of crap

Download link
http://www.microsoft.com/security_essentials/[/quote]

I don’t get what your point is? You ran the file, you don’t get viruses just from downloading byte code and source code…

DanielEkins:

and plus some programs are made to give you a trojan because thats part of the program working

You have to have an exaction though, .java, .txt, .class, .cfg do now execute unless they are called to, by another file that can execute stuff like an .exe or a .bat.

massacre v1:

hmmm this whole lil “antivirus tut” try clicking the "macrovirus.com 1 and see wat u get rofl ur a idiot giving people antivirus advice yet u put a virus on a link ur dumb kk kid

Ok?..

Niklas1996:

Yes they do find viruses lol… i just found a trojan in a server file from this site some mithscape crap GOOD that it found it…

Your a moron, read the thread again. If you read it he or she said this is for source files, you most likely got the virus from the .exe file in the server or client folder, you cannot get a virus from .java or .class files as they can’t execute the code in side them unless a file like a .exe or .bat call them to execute. They cannot run by their self’s.

Read full topic

item.title: You do not need a virus scan for a server!
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

JoeProDucktiions:

there was a re starter that gave me a Trojan that came with the source soo…

The restart was the problem, not the server. Server code cannot give you a virus just sitting there since it needs to be executed for it to do anything. Since you clicked the server restarted you could get a virus because that is executing something.

Read full topic
